sentences.sContent: Marine sponges have a long fossil record (= their development has been recorded over a long period ) .
sentences.sCn: 海绵动物留下了漫长的化石记录。

sentences.sContent: ...If fossil fuel prices remain low for a long time...
...There is strong evidence that both innovation and adoption of cleaner technology are strongly encouraged by higher fossil fuel prices...
...But renewable energy will have to displace fossil fuels to a much greater extent in the future to avoid unacceptable climate risks...
...It is urgent for governments to increase the cost of using fossil fuels to an appropriate level to lessen 	the catastrophic effects of climate change...
...low fossil fuel prices are not accurately signaling to markets the true social profitability of clean energy...
...Even major fossil fuel exporting countries have great potential to develop renewable energies...
...low fossil fuel prices could discourage further innovation in...
...if fossil fuel prices remain low for long...
...Even Africa and the Middle East，home to economies that are heavily dependent on fossil fuel exports...
...Higher fossil fuel prices prove to be conducive to innovation and application of cleaner technology...

synos.tran: [古生]化石；僵化的事物；顽固不化的人

phrases.pCn: [生]活化石；[口]落后于时代的人

remMethod.val: “佛说” → 一开口就是“佛说…”， 真是个老顽固 → 老顽固

words.tran: 石化（fossilize的过去式和过去分词）
变成化石；变陈腐；使过时或固定不变；搜集（或发掘）化石标本

trans.tranCn: 化石； 食古不化的人， 老顽固
trans.tranOther: an animal or plant that lived many thousands of years ago and that has been preserved, or the shape of one of these animals or plants that has been preserved in rock
